node.display_long_description:
Explore the surrealistic Ages of Myst in a new dimension!

Welcome to Myst: the starkly beautiful island, eerily tinged with mystery and shrouded in intrigue. Explore the deeper connections and uncover a story of ruthless family betrayal.

Cyan, the indie studio that created the beloved classic, has reimagined Myst -- built from the ground up for VR and available soon to play on Oculus Quest. With new art, sound, interactions, and even optional puzzle randomization - the highly anticipated Myst VR experience has finally arrived.

Journey to the Ages, unravel the puzzles, and become part of the epic story.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Well hello, everyone! Patch 2 for Myst on Quest is now out!

Everywhere
- Sculpted out a ton more polygon issues
- Triturated up a ton of textures (game size reduced by about 25%!)
- Amalgamated a ton more mesh issues
- Repaired a ton more collision issues
- Tamped down a ton more LOD issues
- Embellished a ton more aesthetic issues
- Decomposed a ton more music issues
- Rived out a ton more paging issues
- Illuminated a ton more lighting issues
- Muted a ton more sound issues
- Extirpated a ton more gnarly bugs

Interface
- Quick travel icon goes away after use
- Snap turn degrees now accurately reflects the number of degrees you end up actually turning

Main Menu
- Added snap turn options for 60 degrees
- Fixed held objects from appearing in menu
- Fixed the disappearing laser pointers after credits 
- Updated randomization text (based on user feedback)
- Moved controller diagram so it is larger

Myst Island
- Added music to the tower (under certain conditions)
- Changed "page to shelf" animation to prevent clipping
- Fixed an Achenar video that would play inside the fireplace
- Fixed "cancel" sound when attempting to delete an Imager message
- Adjusted Stoneship ceiling fan to continue turning while linking
- Fixed planetarium day of the month digit issue
- Fixed sticky imager door when player walks away
- Adjusted quick travel region on generator stairs
- Added collision to counterweight in the clocktower
- Added safety net collision areas around library hallway
- Fixed random golden-colored object issue

Mechanical
- Fixed certain doors issues with save and load
- Fixed misaligned fortress rotation issue
- Adjusted collision near the bridge
- Fixed an issue with the electric cage switch 

Stoneship
- Added fish to the water outside of the book room
- Added new grates to the left and right halls
- Removed the amazing feature of the hanging key infinitely swinging into the lock :(
- Fixed finicky door handles in the compass room
- Fixed the "below the water" chest key issue

Selenitic
- Fixed a sticky bunker door button after save and load
- Fixed misbehaving waveforms issue
- Fixed Mazerunner interior issue after save and load from certain location

Channelwood
- Fixed items in drawers being outside of drawers 
- Changed the rotation max of the elevator levers
- Fixed temple imager freeze frame issue
- Adjusted the washed out torn note in Sirrus' room
- Removed the ability to teleport onto the roof of Achenar's room
- Fixed location of gameplay context subtitles for the water pipe

(and much, much more that we can’t mention because... spoiler!)

e2659-p15479 -- Jenkins build 1157

node.reviewDescription:
I want to start by saying I highly recommend this to everyone. Myst is the best puzzle game out there, and this version absolutely does it justice. However, there are a couple of issues that could have easily been fixed. 

First, I wish they had kept the original FMV actors because the new CG characters don't look great. 

I also wish there were maybe a system to take notes within the game or more easily take pictures. You can take screenshots from the Oculus menu, but it's not extremely convenient to use. My reason for this is you will come across things you need to remember. In the past, I would just write the info down or draw a quick diagram for the constellations and things like that. It can be really difficult trying to remember everything you need to without some sort of note or picture system. 

Lastly, it can be hard to tell what is able to be interacted with just due to the nature of VR. They've certainly tried to fix this in a few places, notably the library. You can't really interact with the burned booze anymore since it would be awkward in VR to clearly choose which book to pick up. I definitely think this will in general be an issue with games that weren't originally built for VR, but it's definitely worth noting given it might add a bit of frustration at times. 

That being said, those are constructive criticisms not reasons to avoid this game. I've wanted Myst VR for so long and I'm happy they did it justice. This is absolutely my new favorite way to play AND I'm happy there's randomized puzzles too so you actually have to play the game even if you remember the original answers. 

Excellent game and definitely worth the purchase.

developerResponse.body:
Thank you for sharing this feedback, Gamer4Life137 - we appreciate your kind words and critique. 
You'll be happy to hear a note-taking feature is being added to the game in an upcoming patch. 
Best wishes!
